Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of NPC-21 for CMV Prevention in Kidney Transplant Recipients

Trial_Design.evidence: multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, phase 2 trial

Intervention.evidence: randomized in a 4:1:4 ratio to receive monthly 6 mg/kg NPC-21, 12 mg/kg NPC-21, or placebo

Objective.evidence: evaluated the efficacy and safety of fiztasovimab (NPC-21), an anti-CMV monoclonal antibody, in kidney transplant (KT) recipients

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was CMV infection by week 16

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was stratified by region (United States or Japan) using an Interactive Response Technology system, with allocation concealed from investigators and patients

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 87 participants were randomized

Number_Analysed.evidence: CMV infections occurred in 76.3%, 81.8%, and 68.4% of patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: CMV infections occurred in 76.3%, 81.8%, and 68.4% of patients

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were observed
